justification: The article states that participants completed “a modified motivational Go/NoGo task capturing Pavlovian choice … bias,” indicating this task is the instrument used to measure Pavlovian bias.
The same sentence refers to the Go/NoGo task as “capturing … instrumental learning bias,” showing this construct is operationalised with that task.

measured_by: feedback sensitivity parameter (ρ +FB and ρ -FB) from RL model of Go/NoGo task
justification: Within the computational modelling section, the paper notes that “feedback sensitivity (ρ) formalizes the degree of choice stochasticity or, put more simplistically, decision noise,” identifying these ρ parameters as the metric for decision-noise.

measured_by: feedback sensitivity parameters (ρ Win +FB, ρ Loss +FB, ρ Win -FB, ρ Loss -FB) from RL model of probabilistic reversal learning task
justification: For the reversal task the authors write, “The task's winning model comprised four feedback sensitivity parameters…,” and later correlate them with decision noise, confirming these parameters quantify decision-noise in that task.
The methods describe “a probabilistic reversal learning task measuring feedback-based cognitive flexibility,” directly linking the construct to the task.
The introduction specifies a “modified sequential ('two-step') decision-making task to assess model-based control,” indicating this task operationalises the construct.
